jcr:content.jcr:title: Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Python vs Java typing example

contentheadline.headline: Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Python vs Java typing example

contentrichtext.text: [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/wiki.phtml?title=MediaWiki:VfD-Python_vs_Java_typing_example this is an archived deletion debate] *Not encyclopedic. Move to Wikibooks? [[User:Fredrik|Fredrik]] 14:52, 4 Apr 2004 (UTC) * Keep. It relates to two languages, hence it is in a separate article, to avoid duplication. the text must be wikified and clarified, though. [[User:Mikkalai|Mikkalai]] 16:49, 4 Apr 2004 (UTC) **I agree that it might be kept if it gets fixed. [[User:Fredrik|Fredrik]] 17:25, 4 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Delete, or put somewhere else appropriate. Are we going to have a ''language x'' vs ''language y'' example for all proramming languages? **I noticed there's also [[Python vs C Plus Plus example]]. [[User:Fredrik|Fredrik]] 22:26, 4 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Delete. I'm a Python fan myself, but an advocacy piece like this doesn't belong in an encyclopedia, even if it's improved. [[User:Josh Cherry|Josh Cherry]] 00:37, 5 Apr 2004 (UTC) * delete. [[User:DJ Clayworth|DJ Clayworth]] 14:20, 5 Apr 2004 (UTC) *Delete, non encyclopedic. Python rocks, no two ways about it -- unfortunately language advocacy isn't suitable for WP. [[User:Wile E. Heresiarch|Wile E. Heresiarch]] 14:03, 7 Apr 2004 (UTC)
